Method evaluate

evaluate( self, e, unit=None, name=None, resolve=True, prefix=None )

Evaluates expressions with the internal expression format, which is as follows:

  • values are encoded as ('V', (value, unit))
  • operations are encoded as ('O', operator, lvalue, rvalue)

Method onSelection

onSelection( self, match, head, tail )

Returns a structure like the following: 

[[('div', '', '', '', ''), '> ', ('label', '', '', '', '')]]
---SELECTOR------------   OP   --SELECTOR---------------

Method onSelectionList

onSelectionList( self, match, head, tail )

Updates the current scope and writes the scope selection line.

Method onSelector

onSelector( self, match, scope, nid, nclass, attributes, suffix )

Selectors are returned as tuples (scope, id, class, attributes, suffix). We need to keep this structure as we need to be able to expand the & reference.

Method onSelectorNarrower

onSelectorNarrower( self, match, op, sel )

Returns a (op, selector) couple.

tuple

('background', 'background-color', 'color', 'gradientlinear-gradient')

tuple() -> empty tuple tuple(iterable) -> tuple initialized from iterable's items

If the argument is a tuple, the return value is the same object.

dict

{'%': <function <lambda> at 0x7f3c96d34c80>, '+': <function <lambda> at 0x7f3c96d34aa0>, '*': <function <lambda> at 0x7f3c96d34b90>, '-': <function <lambda> at 0x7f3c96d34b18>, '/': <function <lambda> at 0x7f3c96d34c08>}

dict() -> new empty dictionary dict(mapping) -> new dictionary initialized from a mapping object's (key, value) pairs dict(iterable) -> new dictionary initialized as if via: d = {} for k, v in iterable: d[k] = v dict(**kwargs) -> new dictionary initialized with the name=value pairs in the keyword argument list. For example: dict(one=1, two=2)

tuple

('animation', 'border-radius', 'box-shadow', 'background-size', 'column-width', 'column-gap', 'column-count', 'filter', 'transition-property', 'transition-duration', 'transition-timing-function', 'transform', 'transform-origin', 'transform-style', 'perspective', 'perspective-origin', 'box-sizing', 'backface-visibility', 'image-rendering', 'user-select')

tuple() -> empty tuple tuple(iterable) -> tuple initialized from iterable's items

If the argument is a tuple, the return value is the same object.

tuple

('transition', 'transition-property')

tuple() -> empty tuple tuple(iterable) -> tuple initialized from iterable's items

If the argument is a tuple, the return value is the same object.

tuple

('', '-moz-', '-webkit-', '-o-', '-ms-')

tuple() -> empty tuple tuple(iterable) -> tuple initialized from iterable's items

If the argument is a tuple, the return value is the same object.

SRE_Pattern

Compiled regular expression objects

NoneType

Undocumented

Class Processor

Replaces some of the grammar's symbols processing functions. This is the main code that converts the parsing's recognized data to the output CSS. There is not really an intermediate AST (excepted for expressions), and the result is streamed out through the _write call.

compile( path, treebuilderClass )

str

'http://ffctn.com/doc/licenses/bsd'

str(object='') -> string

Return a nice string representation of the object. If the argument is a string, the return value is the same object.

str

'0.0.1'

str(object='') -> string

Return a nice string representation of the object. If the argument is a string, the return value is the same object.

Module pythoniccss

Processor for the PythonicCSS language. This module use a PEG-based parsing engine http://github.com/sebastien/parsing, which sadly has an important performance penalty, but offers greated easy of development/update.

str

'http://ffctn.com/doc/licenses/bsd'

str(object='') -> string

Return a nice string representation of the object. If the argument is a string, the return value is the same object.

tuple

('animation', 'border-radius', 'box-shadow', 'background-size', 'column-width', 'column-gap', 'column-count', 'filter', 'transition-property', 'transition-duration', 'transition-timing-function', 'transform', 'transform-origin', 'transform-style', 'perspective', 'perspective-origin', 'box-sizing', 'backface-visibility', 'image-rendering', 'user-select')

tuple() -> empty tuple tuple(iterable) -> tuple initialized from iterable's items

If the argument is a tuple, the return value is the same object.

dict

{'%': <function <lambda> at 0x7f3c96d34c80>, '+': <function <lambda> at 0x7f3c96d34aa0>, '*': <function <lambda> at 0x7f3c96d34b90>, '-': <function <lambda> at 0x7f3c96d34b18>, '/': <function <lambda> at 0x7f3c96d34c08>}

dict() -> new empty dictionary dict(mapping) -> new dictionary initialized from a mapping object's (key, value) pairs dict(iterable) -> new dictionary initialized as if via: d = {} for k, v in iterable: d[k] = v dict(**kwargs) -> new dictionary initialized with the name=value pairs in the keyword argument list. For example: dict(one=1, two=2)

tuple

('background', 'background-color', 'color', 'gradientlinear-gradient')

tuple() -> empty tuple tuple(iterable) -> tuple initialized from iterable's items

If the argument is a tuple, the return value is the same object.

Module pythoniccss

Processor for the PythonicCSS language. This module use a PEG-based parsing engine http://github.com/sebastien/parsing, which sadly has an important performance penalty, but offers greated easy of development/update.

Function doIndent

doIndent( context )

Increases the indent requirement in the parsing context

Class Processor

Replaces some of the grammar's symbols processing functions. This is the main code that converts the parsing's recognized data to the output CSS. There is not really an intermediate AST (excepted for expressions), and the result is streamed out through the _write call.

Function doCheckIndent

doCheckIndent( context )

Ensures that the indent requirement is matched.

getGrammar( )
